section_title: Loose Body/Foreign Body Removal (Evidence: pg no: 5, L182)
names: Loose Body Removal (Evidence: pg no: 5, L182)
Foreign Body Removal (Evidence: pg no: 5, L182)
description: Removal of loose bodies or foreign bodies from the shoulder joint causing mechanical symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 5, L184-L194)
scope: Arthroscopic or open removal of loose or foreign bodies (Evidence: pg no: 5, L184)

documentation: Mechanical symptoms including painful locking, clicking, catching, or popping (Evidence: pg no: 5, L189)

Failure of provider-directed non-surgical management for at least three (3) months in duration, except when the loose body or foreign body has caused an acute restriction of shoulder joint range of motion (Evidence: pg no: 5, L190-L192)
Advanced diagnostic imaging study (e.g., MRI, CT) is conclusive for the presence of a loose body or foreign body within the shoulder joint (Evidence: pg no: 5, L193-L194)

Other potential pathological conditions have been excluded including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain, and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 5, L195-L197)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 5, L199-L200)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; with removal of loose body or foreign body (Evidence: pg no: 13, L559)

notes: Exception for acute restriction of shoulder joint range of motion (i.e., locking) where conservative management period may be waived (Evidence: pg no: 5, L191-L192)
